content:
Hi David.

I am surprised that you used to use these addresses in separate accounts. I believe that they are not separate accounts at Proton, but aliases for one account. Do you have three separate accounts in webmail at proton.com or just one? Does mail sent to any of these addresses go to the one, same account at proton.com or different accounts there?

I believe that you have set up the same account three times in Thunderbird.

You might find benefits in using one account in Thunderbird, identities, and a message filter to file incoming mail by alias into separate sub-folders of your inbox.

You could check my understanding by looking at help information on proton.com.
creator: mozilla98

content: Sorry, that's how IMAP works. Are you sure the new email address can't be set for POP? Anyway, with IMAP, I suggest you each set up filters to COPY desired messages to a separate folder. You would each have to folders other than the inbox, HIS and HERS. The filter could COPY those that are typically to you ( such as those from your personal or business contacts) her filter could the same. Then, browse through other mail in the inbox and copy those to the HIS folder. You would each be able to 'see' the others folder, but you're in a trusting relationship so that wouldn't be an issue. A BENEFIT of an IMAP account is that you could then read messages on your phone.
creator: davidsk

content: TIP: Gmail does allow POP. There is a setting in the online account to allow POP.

creator: davidsk

content:
Thanks David. I had a default account defined. I have four different accounts all had the same issue. The problem was solved with the following:

Thunderbird not opening compose windows (new message, reply, forward) This issue, where clicking on "New Message", "Reply", or "Forward" in Thunderbird doesn't open the compose window, is a common problem with several potential causes. Here's a breakdown of troubleshooting steps to get you back to sending emails:

1. Restart Thunderbird in Troubleshoot Mode If Thunderbird is running, click ≡ > Help > Troubleshoot Mode... and choose Restart. If Thunderbird is closed, hold down the Shift key while starting Thunderbird. In the Thunderbird Troubleshoot Mode dialog box, click Continue in Troubleshoot Mode. If the compose window opens now, it suggests an Add-on or Theme might be interfering. You will need to re-enable add-ons one at a time until you locate the offender.
